page.title: 15 WEST STOKE
page.content: West Stoke is a little village on the road from Funtington to Chichester. There is not much there except some pretty houses and cottages,a few farms and a very nice church.The church is very old and in the churchyard is a Dorset Horn ram which belongs to Fr. Johnson. He breeds sheep and has some more in his other church at Funtington.The most interesting thing about West Stoke is a house called Woodend. The people who owned it were called de Bathe, and one of their sons married the famous actress Lily Langtry in 1897. His father was not very pleased and threw him out,so they lived in Hollandsfield, another house in the village.
